path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/HAECHI_AUDIT/[HAECHI AUDIT] Iskra Market Place Audit Report.pdf

findings.title: increaseAmount and decreaseAmount function has no cardtype check logic
findings.description: The _increaseAmount()_ and _decreaseAmount()_ functions don’t have cardtype checking logic. This will change _marketCards[_cardId].availableCardAmount_ value of ERC721.

findings.title: batchUnregisterCards doesn’t need to check the owner of given _cardIds
findings.description: The batchUnregisterCards function is checking the owner of _cardIds but unregisterCard function already has the onlyCardOwner modifier.

findings.title: Lack of signed data can cause signature replay attack
findings.description: The contract ServerSignVerifier does not include purpose and scope in the signature data, which may lead to a signature replay attack if the same signer is used by multiple contracts.

findings.title: Contract doesn’t check the return value of the transfer function
findings.description: When transferring ERC20 from MarketPlace Contract, the return value is not checked. If you use a token that returns false without reverting when the _transfer_ function fails, the function can be executed even if the _transfer_ function fails.

findings.title: TokenPricer contract must validate expiration value
findings.description: The client sets the expiration value, but the _TokenPricerByVerifying_ contract does not know when the data was created and signed. If there is a price change with a client setting the expiration high, it can cause a problem.
